intro: Pyxidaria subcrenulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water plantain, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are often slightly curled at the edges. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in dense spikes, and it produces small, round seeds. Pyxidaria subcrenulata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
